name: EQ Parametric
description:
This algorithm is a multi-channel, multi-band, parametric EQ.
Each channel can process a number of busses - you might typically have a channel processing one or two busses for a mono or stereo signal, but you could, say, process all 12 of the inputs with the same EQ settings by using a single channel with a width of 12.
The display shows a graphical representation of the EQ curve for the current channel. The frequency and gain of the current band within the channel is indicated with a small box.

parameters.name: Input
parameters.description: The first input bus to process.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: Output
parameters.description: The first output bus. If set to ‘None’, the input bus is used as output, and the mode is always ‘Replace'.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

input_ports.name: Input
input_ports.description: The first input bus to process.

input_ports.name: Width
input_ports.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

input_ports.name: Output
input_ports.description: The first output bus. If set to ‘None’, the input bus is used as output, and the mode is always 'Replace'.

input_ports.name: Output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The first output bus. If set to ‘None’, the input bus is used as output, and the mode is always 'Replace'.
